DataElement.preferredName: Person Control Thyroid Gland Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator whether medicine can control and regulate a person's thyroid function, a highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus, as element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Control Thyroid Gland Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to control and regulation of a person's thyroid function, a highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus, as element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Control Thyroid Gland Function Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.:Function; what something is used for.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a pre-existing thyroid abnormality with thyroid function that cannot be maintained in the normal range with medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient has a history
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a history of hypothyroidism/hyperthyroidism, has the patient had stable well-controlled thyroid function for a minimum of 2 months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have concurrent uncompensated hypothyroidism or thyroid dysfunction within 7 days before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, is the patient able to maintain thyroid function in the normal range with medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have current uncompensated hypothyroidism or thyroid dysfunction within 7 days before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If requires thyroid replacement therapy, have patient been receiving a stable replacement dose for at least 28 days prior to study enrollment

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on a stable dose of thyroid replacement hormone

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled symptomatic hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
